MessageEvent.summary: The MessageEvent interface represents a message received by a target object.

remarks.para: This is used to represent messages in:
The action triggered by this event is defined in a function set as the event handler for the relevant message event.
- — similar to this interface but used in interfaces that needs to give more flexibility to authors.

MessageEventData.summary:
The data read-only property of the
interface represents the data sent by the message emitter.

remarks.para:
- — similar to this interface but used in
interfaces that needs to give more flexibility to authors.

MessageEventData.value: The data sent by the message emitter; this can be any data type, depending on what originated this event.

MessageEventLastEventId.summary:
The lastEventId read-only property of the
interface is a string representing a
unique ID for the event.

remarks.para:
- — similar to this interface but used in
interfaces that needs to give more flexibility to authors.

MessageEventMessageEvent.summary: The MessageEvent() constructor creates a new object.

remarks.para: - — similar to this interface but used in interfaces that needs to give more flexibility to authors.

MessageEventOrigin.summary:
The origin read-only property of the
interface is a string representing the
origin of the message emitter.

remarks.para:
- — similar to this interface but used in
interfaces that needs to give more flexibility to authors.

MessageEventPorts.summary:
The ports read-only property of the
interface is an array of objects
containing all objects sent with the message, in order.

remarks.para:
- — similar to this interface but used in
interfaces that needs to give more flexibility to authors.

MessageEventSource.summary:
The source read-only property of the
interface is a MessageEventSource (which can be
a {{glossary("WindowProxy")}}, , or
object) representing the message emitter.

remarks.para:
- — similar to this interface but used in
interfaces that needs to give more flexibility to authors.

MessageEventSource.value:
a MessageEventSource (which can be a WindowProxy,
, or object) representing the
message emitter.
